Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Reverend Dr. Cheryl Anthony of Judah International Christian Center, Inc.  located at 141 Rogers Avenue, Brooklyn, New York, 11216.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Cornegy.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Dr. Cheryl Anthony of Judah International Chridtian Center, Inc., located at 141 Rogers Avenue, Brooklyn, N.Y. 11216.

Council Member Cornegy moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee (Council Member Salamanca)
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the actions of the City Planning Commission on Application Nos. C 190084 ZSK and C 190085 ZSK (103 North 13th Street Special Permit)  shall be subject to Council review. These applications are related to Application No. N 190083 ZRK.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 103 North 13th Street Special Permit, Brooklyn (C190084ZSK, C190085ZSK and N190083ZRK)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the registration of vacant storefront property
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Requiring the registration of vacant storefront property.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring owners to submit registration statements regarding ground floor and second floor commercial premises
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Requiring owners to submit registration statements regarding ground floor and second floor commercial premises.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of small business services to offer certain business services including training and education
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of small business services to offer certain business services including training and education.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of buildings to include the existing and proposed building height when notifying council members and community boards of applications received, approved and rejected
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring the DOB to include the existing and proposed building height when notifying council members and community boards of applications received, approved and rejected.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of education to report on humane animal treatment instruction
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of education to report on humane animal treatment instruction.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the creation of a regulatory review panel to review provisions of the administrative code of the city of New York, the rules of the city of New York, the New York city health code, the New York city construction codes and state law and recommend cure periods for violations of certain provisions
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Recommend cure periods for violations of certain provisions.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to information about city laws and rules that apply to small businesses
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Information about city laws and rules that apply to small businesses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a report on permits issued for the use of athletic fields under the jurisdiction of the parks department
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Report on permits issued for the use of athletic fields under the jurisdiction of the parks dept.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the use of golf carts powered by gas, diesel, or any other carbon-based fuel after January 1, 2026
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting the use of golf carts powered by gas, diesel, or any other carbon-based fuel after January 1, 2026.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to legal services for small business tenants
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Small Business
Items.MatterName: Legal services for small business tenants.

Items.Title: Resolution calling Congress to pass and the President to sign, S.3503, the American Housing and Economic Mobility Act.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: American Housing and Economic Mobility Act. (S.3503)

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Gounardes, Addabbo, Bailey, Benjamin, Biaggi, Comrie, Gianaris, Holyman, Jackson, Kavanagh, Krueger, Liu, Montgomery, Myrie, Parker, Persuad, Ramos, Rivera, Salazar, Sanders, Savino, Sepulveda, Serrano, Stavisky, S.4331, and Assembly Members Glick, Cymbrowitz, Arroyo, A.6449, â€œAN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to photo  speed violation  monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city of New York; to amend chapter 43 of the laws of 2014,  amending  the  vehicle and traffic law, the public officers law and the general municipal law relating  to  photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in the city  of  New  York,  in  relation  to  making  technical corrections  thereto;  and  to  amend chapter 189 of the laws of 2013, amending the vehicle and traffic  law  and  the  public  officers  law relating to establishing in a city with a population of one million or more  a  demonstration program implementing speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones by means of photo devices,  in  relation to the effectiveness thereofâ€.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Photo speed violation monitoring systems in school speed zones in NYC (S.4331/ A.6449).
